content: roomy raglan by jules efterfield materials dimensions- needles- from top of collar to hem- 24 4 5 mm 6 mm 6 5 mm width of body- 27 50 cm cable 80 cm cable top of collar to sleeve hem- 28 underarm to sleeve hem- 13 yarn- cascade yarn ecological wool bulky 500g construction- 2 250g/478 yards skeins this is a raglan style sweater that is worked held with top down first the collar is knit then german short row are worked to shape the neckline blue sky fiber woolstock light fingering then you ll continue the raglan shaping in the 200g 4 50g/218 yards skeins yoke the yoke is knit quite deep to mimic the proportions of a babaà sweater there are additional row knit in the back before other- splitting for sleeves to help raise the back and to create a more oversized roomy fit the tapestry needle sleeves are designed to be bracelet length but measuring tape can be modified to be longer as needed stitch markers- one unique 4 for raglan abbreviations - increases and 7 for sleeve decreases c/o cast on bor- beginning of the round gauge- m- marker 14 stitches x 22 row in stockinette on m1r- make one right 6 5 mm needles m1l- make one left m1lp- make one left purl sizing- m1rp- make one right purl as this is a babaà inspired piece this is k2tog- knit two stitches together designed to be one size there are many opportunities in this pattern to modify as you ssk- slip slip knit need to increase or decrease the size the sample has a finished length of 24 and width of 27 when laid flat 2 notes- if your two strands are the same color you can skip knitting the cast on edge cu cid 431 hem and body hem in the single strand of bulky yarn this is done to create a contrasting edge with the marled knit and is unnecessary if the two strands are the same color when you switch from the 4 5 mm needle to the 6 5 mm needle after finishing the collar the stitches will feel tight on the needles metal needles can help with keeping the stitches moving or if you work with interchangeable needles you can put a smaller tip on your left side but just remember to switch them as you turn your work to do the short row to modify the sweater to be larger once you ve knit the yoke to 12 you can continue working rounds but only work the increases on the body not the sleeves with the raglan construction you re able to try it on as you go to achieve your desired fit to modify sleeve length you can either add another row of decreases which will make the cu cid 431 a little tighter or do decrease every 7 row instead of 6 to gain an extra 1 25 in the sleeve pattern begins here collar- using the
